title: Berkshire live: Wednesday 23 November - BBC News
summary: fire crews called to remove lorry wedged between buildings .
west berkshire council to reduce number of councillors .
blue badge parking app piloted in reading .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thank you for joining us today .
we 'll be back again at 08:00 gmt tomorrow with all berkshire 's latest news , travel and weather .
keep up to date on our facebook and twitter pages .

South Online

documents.title: 'a great surge in political opinion '
text: earlier today , writer and broadcaster matthew parris joined bbc radio berkshire 's anne diamond to discuss a roller-coaster year in politics , including the eu referendum , and donald trump 's election victory .

documents.title: 'vehicle idling ' fine plans to be discussed
text: a meeting to discuss plans to fine drivers who keep their engines running while stationary will be discussed at reading borough council this evening .
the authority is considering issuing the penalty notices to motorists who keep their engines on for more than one minute while not moving .
the proposal to combat `` vehicle idling '' comes after environment minister dr therese coffey said the borough had `` not reduced pollutant levels far enough '' .
read more about the plans here .

documents.title: berkshire weather latest
text: it is expected to remain overcast this evening with a chance of light rain outbreaks overnight .
conditions are forecast to remain chilly tomorrow .

documents.title: reading buses take home bus award
text: reading buses won the silver award at the uk bus awards , after being named as top shire operator for the fourth year in a row .
wow !
we 've won top shire operator at the # ukbusawards - what an absolute honour and a great endorsement of our entire team !
well done all : )
@ twitterid wow , what an achievement ! !
congrats to all you guys !
# ukbusawards
brilliant
well done !

documents.title: pedestrian dies after m4 crash near reading
text: a 19-year-old man has died in hospital after being hit by a car on the m4 in reading .
the incident happened on the westbound carriageway between junction 11 at reading and junction 12 theale at about 16:50 gmt on friday .
south central ambulance service said the man was struck by a car close to reading services .
he died in hospital on tuesday .
the road was closed for up to four hours following the accident .

documents.title: bus lane to be extended in reading
text: plans to extend a bus lane on the a33 in reading are set to be approved at a council meeting .
work is already under way on phase one of works between the imperial way roundabout , through to the start of one of the existing bus lanes at junction 11 .
if approved , the bus lane will be extended to the a33 junction with lindisfarne way , where it joins kennet island .

documents.title: lorry gets wedged in village road
text: lorry gets wedged in village road

documents.title: poppies wins council competition
text: this stunning of poppies was the winner in west berkshire council 's photography competition .
it was taken by yvonne , one of the council library supervisors .

documents.title: stam focused on taking it step by stepreading fc press conference
text: jaap stam had little good news to give reading fans on the injury front ahead of saturday 's game at bristol city .
striker yann kermorgant is still out with a knee injury , and john swift faces a long lay off .
anssi jaakkola , the royals reserve goalkeeper , has however returned to training this week .
his side are flying high right now , they have won four wins on the bounce , and sit third in the championship table - right where fans want to be .
plenty of attention has therefore been focused on reading ( they were even compared to barcelona and manchester city on saturday nights highlights programme ) .
jaap stam , though , seems intent on ignoring the noise and focusing solely on this weekend 's game .
author: Adam Whitty
BBC Berkshire

documents.title: lorry removed - but road stays closed
text: the a329 streatley crossroads & b4009 streatley hill remains closed while the chimney stack hit by the lorry is made safe .
fire crews are checking it does n't collapse into the street .

documents.title: 'smitten ' bank worker jailed for fraud
text: a former bank employee has been jailed for two years after admitting transferring £ 53,000 from the accounts of 14 elderly customers to a mystery man she had only met three times .
natasha bassi , 23 , from southampton , moved the funds over eight months in 2014 while working as an adviser at a branch of santander in reading .
she moved the money to a man called `` leroy '' with whom she was `` smitten '' .
the judge said she had `` put aside all honesty and integrity '' .

documents.title: wedged lorry successfully removed
text: the lorry which hit a house and became wedged between two houses on a tiny road in streatley has been removed .
fire crews said the vehicle had damaged the chimney stack of the house it struck .
the incident resulted in the crossroads next to the 15th century bull pub to be closed .
the truck has been moved but junction still shut
oh my that has ruined somebody 's day !
# oops

documents.title: they 're through to the semi finals !
text: the bulmershe ensemble appeared on television last night as part of the choir : gareth 's best in britain , where they were selected to represent the south east region .

documents.title: 'it would be closed for two to three months '
text: oxfordshire county council are bidding for £ 7 million worth of funding from the government to raise the playhatch road in sonning - which last flooded in 2014 .

documents.title: breakingex-bank worker jailed for stealing £ 53k from accounts of elderly customers
text: former employee natasha bassi has been jailed for two years after admitting transferring £ 53,000 from the accounts of elderly customers at santander bank .
southampton crown court heard she had been working as an advisor to customers at a reading branch of the bank when she committed the offences between may and december 2014 .
bassi , 23 , of cobden crescent , southampton , pleaded guilty to committing fraud .

documents.title: berkshire and oxfordshire crews helping with trapped lorry
text: incident : crews from @ twitterid along with fire crews from @ twitterid assisting with hgv into building.reading road , streatley .
is a329 open since hgv is removed ?

documents.title: 'we ca n't get in the house '
text: tim schulz , who lives in the annexe of the house which has been hit in streatley said : `` it 's pretty insane actually .
i do n't know how he ever thought he could get round the corner .
`` he 's totally taken out the chimney stack , so we ca n't get in the house , because it might fall in the house .
`` the best case scenario is it falls into the road . ''
tim said he heard a `` crunching '' as the lorry hit .
`` he said my other half came out the shower , then we came outside and there was a truck which had taken out the chimney .
`` it 's taken a wedge out of the side of the pub , it was a bit more substantial than the chimney stack .
`` i ca n't tell if the lorry or the pub has come off worse . ''
update : you can turn right as you come up streatley high street but not left towards pangbourne

documents.title: autumn statement idea 'naive '
text: we 're waiting for the chancellor to make his autumn statement this lunchtime .
promising to improve the living standards of working class people , philip hammond is expected to announce a ban on up-front letting agent fees .
we 've been hearing this morning from wokingham estate agent neal mckenzie who does n't think it will work in the long run .

`` i think it would be naive to think that the cost of this is not going to get passed on in some way to the tenant - because the landlord is not sitting there making huge profits - a lot of these landlords are in the 'just managing ' group as well ``
author: Sam Clayton
BBC Radio Berkshire newsreader

documents.title: west berkshire council to reduce number of councillors
text: west berkshire council has approved a reduction to the number of councillors elected to represent residents .
at a meeting last night it was decided the number would drop from 52 to 42 .
it will now be proposed to the local government boundary commission for england - which is responsible for conducting reviews of local authority electoral arrangements .
the commission will consider the change and may hold a public consultation before deciding whether to accept the decision .
councillor roger croft , leader of west berkshire council , welcomed the proposed reduction and said it would `` deliver savings '' .
in reaching a decision to reduce the number of councillors , the proposal considered :

now that the number of councillors has been considered , the next stage will be to review individual ward boundaries wards so that all councillors represent a similarly sized population.the changes , if approved , will take effect after the next district council elections which are expected in may 2019 .
author: Emma Midgley
BBC News

documents.title: blue badge parking app piloted in reading
text: in a first for the uk , reading will pilot new technology designed to help disabled drivers .
a smartphone app has been developed to help users find blue badge spaces quickly .
the 'simon ' project has been hailed a huge success in places including spain and portugal .
author: Emma Midgley
BBC News

documents.title: water water everywhere
text: there are still two warnings that `` flooding is possible '' on rivers in berkshire .
five other warnings which had been in place have now been lifted , although this tweet from reading suggests there is still plenty of water around this morning .
the holy brook has burst its banks just south of coley park .
dog loves it !

BBC Berkshire online

documents.title: dean evans : 'courageous son ' died fighting is
text: a british man who died fighting the so-called islamic state in syria has been described by his stepfather as `` courageous not stupid '' .
dean evans , 22 , from reading , died in july in the syrian city of manbij , after joining the people 's defence units ( ypg ) , a kurdish military group .
his stepfather steve howell told the victoria derbyshire programme his stepson was `` a martyr '' .
and both he and dean 's stepmother tracey are `` proud of what he did '' .

documents.title: berkshire weather : better than yesterday
text: it 's a better day than we 've had recently , it is admittedly grey but will be mainly day with the possibility of some rain this afternoon .
temperatures will average around 8c .

BBC Weather
